snippet: Seven earthquake experts had been convicted of manslaughter for failing to adequately warn residents before a 2009 quake that killed more than 300 people.
abstract: Italian appeals court clears seven prominent Italian earthquake experts who were accused of failing to adequately warn residents of seismically active are in months before 2009 earthquake that killed more than 300 people.
lead_paragraph: Seven earthquake experts had been convicted of manslaughter for failing to adequately warn residents before a 2009 quake that killed more than 300 people.

headline.main: Italian Appeals Court Overturns Guilty Verdicts in Earthquake Trial
